@victornoel I am using the standard intellij config.
To be honest, I've never seen the indent style before in Java. And as far as I can see in the code of the project, everything else is correctly indented and only this line seems to have had a wrong indent before, which was now fixed since I always reformat and optimize imports for all touched files.
new Randomized(
    'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h'
).asString()

looks better and is easier to follow than
new Randomized(
'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h'
).asString()

Please let me know what you think and if I should revert the change. But imho, this is the correct formatting the code should have.
